intro: Cyanotis somaliensis var. uda, commonly known as the Somali bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand dry conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a basal rosette. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
